content: we re in this together rainbow bear donna childs designer © 2020 this little bear was designed during the early days of the covid-19 quarantine first as a fun little project in case you need one and second to set in a window as a way to spread a little cheer you likely have all the materials you need to make these--i designed it specifically knowing you probably can t get out to your favorite yarn or craft shop for a little while and it s such a quick and easy project you ll be able to whip one up anytime someone might need a little cheering ​ ​ up--even if that someone is you the pattern is for a very basic teddy bear and there are many ways to vary the pattern to make it unique in your own style--see suggestions on the last page i hope you have as much fun making some of these little bears as i had coming up with him tools and materials yarn worsted weight yarn small amounts suggested in rainbow colors ​ see last page for ideas for variations hook g 4 0 mm or whatever hook will give you a firm fabric without holes ​ notions embroidery floss or yarn for features button or upholstery thread and sewing thread in preferred colors various sized needles yarn sewing embroidery two buttons or beads for eyes suggested size ⅛ to ½ in black or preferred color two 2-hole buttons for joins suggested size ⅜ to ½ in same color of yarn or preferred color stuffing finished size approx 6 5 16 5 cm standing ​ let s make some bears right now--they re so easy buttons are used for eyes and arm joins--if you intend to let a baby or small child play with these i suggest you simply sew on the arms and embroider the eyes for safety this pattern is my gift to you and it will always be free i ask only that you share your project with others in a way to spread a little cheer--even if it s as a gift of self-love and--please--don t forget to show off your creations on my ravelry page https //www ravelry com/designers/donna-childs pattern for bear note most pieces are worked in the round without turning--work in continuous rounds ​ as in a spiral without joining unless otherwise noted when fastening off individual pieces leave a long yarn tail for sewing us terms used throughout basic body head and body are worked in one piece round 1 chain 4 slip_stitch in beg st to make ring chain 1 and work 6 single_crochet in ring 6 sts do not join or turn but cont to work into previous round here and throughout round 2 work 2 single_crochet in each st 12 sts round 3 work 2 single_crochet in first st 1 single_crochet in next st 6 times 18 sts round 4 work 2 single_crochet in first st 1 single_crochet in each of next
